data.title: How a Billionaire Banker Is Helping Elite US Colleges Recruit New Talent
data.meta_description: Byron Trott says the small Missouri town where he grew up wasn’t the kind of place that got regular visits from admissions officers at Yale, MIT or his own alma mater, the University of Chicago.
data.text:
Banker’s $20 million push is aimed at underserved areas, kids

Colleges are rethinking admissions after Supreme Court ruling

Byron Trott says the small Missouri town where he grew up wasn’t the kind of place that got regular visits from admissions officers at Yale, MIT or his own alma mater, the University of Chicago.

Now the billionaire banker, who rose to the top levels of Goldman Sachs Group Inc. before founding his own firm, is backing an effort to change that.
